solution_line_template: The cost of the planks for one birdhouse is {planks_per_birdhouse} * {plank_cost} = $<<{planks_per_birdhouse}*{plank_cost}={plank_total_cost}>>{plank_total_cost}.
And the nails are a cost of {nails_per_birdhouse} * {nail_cost} = $<<{nails_per_birdhouse}*{nail_cost}={nail_total_cost}>>{nail_total_cost} for each birdhouse.
So to build one birdhouse one will need {plank_total_cost} + {nail_total_cost} = $<<{plank_total_cost}+{nail_total_cost}={single_birdhouse_cost}>>{single_birdhouse_cost}.
So the cost of building {num_birdhouses} birdhouses is at {num_birdhouses} * {single_birdhouse_cost} = $<<{num_birdhouses}*{single_birdhouse_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
